page.title: 07HIGH AND LOW PENNYVENIE-2
page.content:
The Dalmellington-New Cumnock road (B741) passes near the terraced houses and latterly there was a regular bus service on the route. This brought Dalmellington within a few minutes journey. For a time there was a mobile shop. The children went to their own school.
Mr Ireland's account and others say that life in the 'rows' was often happy. The houses lacked modern amenities and were often overcrowded. This was offset by a willingness to co-operate with and help each other.
All that remains now are some ruins and the memories of those who used to live in High or Low Pennyvenie and elsewhere in the Cummock Valley.
